revision.text:
On this page we look at transforming the OtherXML dap:Attribute type to RDF. ==SourceXML== simpleContent simpleContent TextContent of Complex Type ==RDF== TextContent of Complex Type simpleContent simpleContent == Hacked HFRadar Example == === Example 1 === In which an entire coverage description is inserted into a DDX as OtherXML ==== Source XML ==== 
  
  Near-Real Time Surface Ocean Velocity CoverageDescription generated by OPeNDAP WCS UseCase 2.0 coverage/200803061600_HFRadar_USEGC_6km_rtv_SIO.nc    -97.8839 21.736 -57.2312 46.4944    2008-03-27T16:00:00.000Z     surface_eastward_sea_water_velocity Eastward component of a 2D sea surface velocity vector. u    -32768  nearest    surface_northward_sea_water_velocity Northward component of a 2D sea surface velocity vector. v    -32768  nearest    longitudinal dilution of precision The longitudinal dilution of precision (DOPx) represents the\\012contribution of the radars' configuration geometry to\\012uncertainty in the eastward velocity estimate (u). DOPx is a\\012direct multiplier of the standard error in obtaining the\\012standard deviation for the eastward velocity estimate from the\\012least squares best fit. DOPx and DOPy are commonly used to\\012obtain the geometric dilution of precision\\012(GDOP = sqrt(DOPx^2 + DOPy^2)), a useful metric for filtering\\012errant velocities due to poor geometry.  DOPx    -32768  nearest    latitudinal dilution of precision The latitudinal dilution of precision (DOPy) represents the\\012contribution of the radars' configuration geometry to\\012uncertainty in the northward velocity estimate (v). DOPy is a\\012direct multiplier of the standard error in obtaining the\\012standard deviation for the northward velocity estimate from the\\012least squares best fit. DOPx and DOPy are commonly used to\\012obtain the geometric dilution of precision\\012(GDOP = sqrt(DOPx^2 + DOPy^2)), a useful metric for filtering\\012errant velocities due to poor geometry.  DOPy    -32768  nearest    urn:ogc:def:crs:EPSG::4326 netcdf-cf1.0 dap2.0  
  Contributing radar site code     Contributing radar site network affiliation code     netcdf library version 3.6.1 of Feb 3 2008 23:15:25 $   HFRNet_1.0.0b2   HFRNet_1.1.01   CF-1.1   Near-Real Time Surface Ocean Velocity   Scripps Institution of Oceanography   Surface Ocean HF-Radar   12-Mar-2008 22:26:19: NetCDF file created   Terrill, E. et al., 2006. Data Management and Real-time\\012Distribution in the HF-Radar National Network. Proceedings\\012of the MTS/IEEE Oceans 2006 Conference, Boston MA,\\012September 2006.    Mark Otero   motero@mpl.ucsd.edu   http://cordc.ucsd.edu/projects/mapping/   Surface ocean velocities estimated from HF-Radar are\\012representitive of the upper 0.3 - 2.5 meters of the\\012ocean. The main objective of near-real time\\012processing is to produce the best product from\\012available data at the time of processing. Radial\\012velocity measurements are obtained from individual\\012radar sites through the HF-Radar Network and\\012processed to create near-real time velocities\\012(RTVs)    21.73596001   46.49441910   -97.88385010   -57.23120880   6km   equidistant cylindrical   Unites States, East and Gulf Coast     time  
  time   seconds since 1970-01-01   gregorian       latitude   degrees_north       longitude   degrees_east       surface_eastward_sea_water_velocity   m s-1   -32768   0.009999999776   DOPx                       surface_northward_sea_water_velocity   m s-1   -32768   0.009999999776   DOPy                       longitudinal dilution of precision   The longitudinal dilution of precision (DOPx) represents the\\012contribution of the radars' configuration geometry to\\012uncertainty in the eastward velocity estimate (u). DOPx is a\\012direct multiplier of the standard error in obtaining the\\012standard deviation for the eastward velocity estimate from the\\012least squares best fit. DOPx and DOPy are commonly used to\\012obtain the geometric dilution of precision\\012(GDOP = sqrt(DOPx^2 + DOPy^2)), a useful metric for filtering\\012errant velocities due to poor geometry.    -32768   0.009999999776                       latitudinal dilution of precision   The latitudinal dilution of precision (DOPy) represents the\\012contribution of the radars' configuration geometry to\\012uncertainty in the northward velocity estimate (v). DOPy is a\\012direct multiplier of the standard error in obtaining the\\012standard deviation for the northward velocity estimate from the\\012least squares best fit. DOPx and DOPy are commonly used to\\012obtain the geometric dilution of precision\\012(GDOP = sqrt(DOPx^2 + DOPy^2)), a useful metric for filtering\\012errant velocities due to poor geometry.    -32768   0.009999999776                       Contributing radar site latitudes   latitude   degrees_north       Contributing radar site longitudes   longitude   degrees_east       RTV processing parameters   \\01201) Maximum GDOP threshold\\01202) Maximum speed threshold (cm s-1)\\01203) Minimum number of sites required\\01204) Minimum number of radials required\\01205) Maximum angular gap to interpolate radial\\012 data over (degrees, 0 = no interpolation)\\01206) Maximum gap in range to interpolate radial\\012 data over (range-resolution, 0 = no interpolation)\\01207) Spatial search radius for radial solutions (km)
==== XSLT ==== 
      ]>   
 .rdf /att#

  &XSD;byte &XSD;short &XSD;unsignedShort &XSD;long &XSD;unsignedLong &XSD;float &XSD;double &XSD;string &XSD;anyURI

 Arrays of Arrays ar not permitted in the DAP. Since this XSL should be processing a legitimate DDX, this error should never occur. (rofl)

DOPx is a\\012direct multiplier of the standard error in obtaining the\\012standard deviation for the eastward velocity estimate from the\\012least squares best fit. DOPx and DOPy are commonly used to\\012obtain the geometric dilution of precision\\012(GDOP = sqrt(DOPx^2 + DOPy^2)), a useful metric for filtering\\012errant velocities due to poor geometry. DOPx -32768 nearest latitudinal dilution of precision The latitudinal dilution of precision (DOPy) represents the\\012contribution of the radars' configuration geometry to\\012uncertainty in the northward velocity estimate (v). DOPy is a\\012direct multiplier of the standard error in obtaining the\\012standard deviation for the northward velocity estimate from the\\012least squares best fit. DOPx and DOPy are commonly used to\\012obtain the geometric dilution of precision\\012(GDOP = sqrt(DOPx^2 + DOPy^2)), a useful metric for filtering\\012errant velocities due to poor geometry. Data Management and Real-time\\012Distribution in the HF-Radar National Network. Proceedings\\012of the MTS/IEEE Oceans 2006 Conference, Boston MA,\\012September 2006. Mark Otero motero@mpl.ucsd.edu http://cordc.ucsd.edu/projects/mapping/ Surface ocean velocities estimated from HF-Radar are\\012representitive of the upper 0.3 - 2.5 meters of the\\012ocean. The main objective of near-real time\\012processing is to produce the best product from\\012available data at the time of processing. Radial\\012velocity measurements are obtained from individual\\012radar sites through the HF-Radar Network and\\012processed to create near-real time velocities\\012(RTVs) 21.73596001 46.49441910 -97.88385010 -57.23120880 6km equidistant cylindrical Unites States, East and Gulf Coast time time seconds since 1970-01-01 gregorian 1 time time latitude degrees_north 460 lat lat longitude degrees_east 701 lon lon surface_eastward_sea_water_velocity m s-1 -32768 0.009999999776 DOPx 1 time 460 lat 701 lon u.u 1 time u.time 460 lat u.lat 701 lon u.lon u surface_northward_sea_water_velocity m s-1 -32768 0.009999999776 DOPy 1 time 460 lat 701 lon v.v 1 time v.time 460 lat v.lat 701 lon v.lon v longitudinal dilution of precision The longitudinal dilution of precision (DOPx) represents the\\012contribution of the radars' configuration geometry to\\012uncertainty in the eastward velocity estimate (u). DOPx is a\\012direct multiplier of the standard error in obtaining the\\012standard deviation for the eastward velocity estimate from the\\012least squares best fit. DOPx and DOPy are commonly used to\\012obtain the geometric dilution of precision\\012(GDOP = sqrt(DOPx^2 + DOPy^2)), a useful metric for filtering\\012errant velocities due to poor geometry. -32768 0.009999999776 1 time 460 lat 701 lon DOPx.DOPx 1 time DOPx.time 460 lat DOPx.lat 701 lon DOPx.lon DOPx latitudinal dilution of precision The latitudinal dilution of precision (DOPy) represents the\\012contribution of the radars' configuration geometry to\\012uncertainty in the northward velocity estimate (v). DOPy is a\\012direct multiplier of the standard error in obtaining the\\012standard deviation for the northward velocity estimate from the\\012least squares best fit. DOPx and DOPy are commonly used to\\012obtain the geometric dilution of precision\\012(GDOP = sqrt(DOPx^2 + DOPy^2)), a useful metric for filtering\\012errant velocities due to poor geometry. -32768 0.009999999776 1 time 460 lat 701 lon DOPy.DOPy 1 time DOPy.time 460 lat DOPy.lat 701 lon DOPy.lon DOPy Contributing radar site latitudes latitude degrees_north 27 nSites site_lat Contributing radar site longitudes longitude degrees_east 27 nSites site_lon RTV processing parameters \\01201) Maximum GDOP threshold\\01202) Maximum speed threshold (cm s-1)\\01203) Minimum number of sites required\\01204) Minimum number of radials required\\01205) Maximum angular gap to interpolate radial\\012 data over (degrees, 0 = no interpolation)\\01206) Maximum gap in range to interpolate radial\\012 data over (range-resolution, 0 = no interpolation)\\01207) Spatial search radius for radial solutions (km) 7 nProcParam procParams === Example 2 === In which missing components for WCS are added throughout the DDX as other XML. ====Source XML for example 2 ====

DOPx is a\\012direct multiplier of the standard error in obtaining the\\012standard deviation for the eastward velocity estimate from the\\012least squares best fit. DOPx and DOPy are commonly used to\\012obtain the geometric dilution of precision\\012(GDOP = sqrt(DOPx^2 + DOPy^2)), a useful metric for filtering\\012errant velocities due to poor geometry.    -32768   0.009999999776                           nearest    latitudinal dilution of precision   The latitudinal dilution of precision (DOPy) represents the\\012contribution of the radars' configuration geometry to\\012uncertainty in the northward velocity estimate (v). DOPy is a\\012direct multiplier of the standard error in obtaining the\\012standard deviation for the northward velocity estimate from the\\012least squares best fit. DOPx and DOPy are commonly used to\\012obtain the geometric dilution of precision\\012(GDOP = sqrt(DOPx^2 + DOPy^2)), a useful metric for filtering\\012errant velocities due to poor geometry.    -32768   0.009999999776                       Contributing radar site latitudes   latitude   degrees_north       Contributing radar site longitudes   longitude   degrees_east       RTV processing parameters   \\01201) Maximum GDOP threshold\\01202) Maximum speed threshold (cm s-1)\\01203) Minimum number of sites required\\01204) Minimum number of radials required\\01205) Maximum angular gap to interpolate radial\\012 data over (degrees, 0 = no interpolation)\\01206) Maximum gap in range to interpolate radial\\012 data over (range-resolution, 0 = no interpolation)\\01207) Spatial search radius for radial solutions (km)
==== XSLT v2 ==== Same As Previous. The algorithm for converting the contents of the otherXML element from XML to RDF/XML is as follows, more or less. This makes them consistent with the transform of XMLschema in ontologies. * elements that are pure content are unchanged * attributes are changed to children * elements with children have a rdf:parseType="Resource" attribute added * mixed elements, i.e both content and children (which at this point means both child elements and xml attributes, since the attributes are changed to children), have the content moved to a child element rdf:value * empty elements have a rdf:resource="http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#nil" attribute added * namespaces that have an implicit '#' between the namespace and the Qname (i.e. XML Schema style) are changed to explicitly end in '#' * local elements and attributes are changed to a particular namespace, http://iridl.ldeo.columbia.edu/ontologies/xsd2owl/nonamespace# and it would be very nice to have * a tag added for each Schema referenced At least that would be one way to know that that particular schema is needed to understand the contents of the current system. ==== RDF for example 2 ==== -97.8839 21.736 -57.2312 46.4944 2008-03-27T16:00:00.000Z urn:ogc:def:crs:EPSG::4326 netcdf-cf1.0 dap2.0 ---- Benno Thinks it should look like this: urn:ogc:def:crs:EPSG::4326 -97.8839 21.736 -57.2312 46.4944 2008-03-27T16:00:00.000Z urn:ogc:def:crs:EPSG::4326 netcdf-cf1.0 dap2.0 ---- Contributing radar site code Contributing radar site network affiliation code netcdf library version 3.6.1 of Feb 3 2008 23:15:25 $ HFRNet_1.0.0b2 HFRNet_1.1.01 CF-1.1 Near-Real Time Surface Ocean Velocity Scripps Institution of Oceanography Surface Ocean HF-Radar 12-Mar-2008 22:26:19: NetCDF file created Terrill, E. et al., 2006. Data Management and Real-time\\012Distribution in the HF-Radar National Network. Proceedings\\012of the MTS/IEEE Oceans 2006 Conference, Boston MA,\\012September 2006. Mark Otero motero@mpl.ucsd.edu http://cordc.ucsd.edu/projects/mapping/ Surface ocean velocities estimated from HF-Radar are\\012representitive of the upper 0.3 - 2.5 meters of the\\012ocean. The main objective of near-real time\\012processing is to produce the best product from\\012available data at the time of processing. Radial\\012velocity measurements are obtained from individual\\012radar sites through the HF-Radar Network and\\012processed to create near-real time velocities\\012(RTVs) 21.73596001 46.49441910 -97.88385010 -57.23120880 6km equidistant cylindrical Unites States, East and Gulf Coast time time seconds since 1970-01-01 gregorian 1 time time latitude degrees_north 460 lat lat longitude degrees_east 701 lon lon Eastward component of a 2D sea surface velocity vector. nearest ---- Benno Thinks it should look like this: Eastward component of a 2D sea surface velocity vector. nearest ---- surface_eastward_sea_water_velocity m s-1 -32768 0.009999999776 DOPx 1 time 460 lat 701 lon u.u 1 time u.time 460 lat u.lat 701 lon u.lon u Northward component of a 2D sea surface velocity vector. nearest surface_northward_sea_water_velocity m s-1 -32768 0.009999999776 DOPy 1 time 460 lat 701 lon v.v 1 time v.time 460 lat v.lat 701 lon v.lon v nearest longitudinal dilution of precision The longitudinal dilution of precision (DOPx) represents the\\012contribution of the radars' configuration geometry to\\012uncertainty in the eastward velocity estimate (u). DOPx is a\\012direct multiplier of the standard error in obtaining the\\012standard deviation for the eastward velocity estimate from the\\012least squares best fit. DOPx and DOPy are commonly used to\\012obtain the geometric dilution of precision\\012(GDOP = sqrt(DOPx^2 + DOPy^2)), a useful metric for filtering\\012errant velocities due to poor geometry. -32768 0.009999999776 1 time 460 lat 701 lon DOPx.DOPx 1 time DOPx.time 460 lat DOPx.lat 701 lon DOPx.lon DOPx nearest latitudinal dilution of precision The latitudinal dilution of precision (DOPy) represents the\\012contribution of the radars' configuration geometry to\\012uncertainty in the northward velocity estimate (v). DOPy is a\\012direct multiplier of the standard error in obtaining the\\012standard deviation for the northward velocity estimate from the\\012least squares best fit. DOPx and DOPy are commonly used to\\012obtain the geometric dilution of precision\\012(GDOP = sqrt(DOPx^2 + DOPy^2)), a useful metric for filtering\\012errant velocities due to poor geometry. -32768 0.009999999776 1 time 460 lat 701 lon DOPy.DOPy 1 time DOPy.time 460 lat DOPy.lat 701 lon DOPy.lon DOPy Contributing radar site latitudes latitude degrees_north 27 nSites site_lat Contributing radar site longitudes longitude degrees_east 27 nSites site_lon RTV processing parameters \\01201) Maximum GDOP threshold\\01202) Maximum speed threshold (cm s-1)\\01203) Minimum number of sites required\\01204) Minimum number of radials required\\01205) Maximum angular gap to interpolate radial\\012 data over (degrees, 0 = no interpolation)\\01206) Maximum gap in range to interpolate radial\\012 data over (range-resolution, 0 = no interpolation)\\01207) Spatial search radius for radial solutions (km) 7 nProcParam procParams [[Category:Development|DAP3/4]] [[Category:DAP4|DAP3/4]] [[Category:WCS]]
